millsfield:images_texts:
727-200
For Your Safety
Sun Country Airlines
Emergency exits are often heavy, awkward to lift, push, pull, and maneuver when opening.
Because of this, and for the benefit of all passengers, Federal Law requires that we seat only
able bodied passengers next to emergency exits.
If you are sitting in the row of seats next to an exit, you may be asked to open the exit and assist
our crew in the event of an emergency. Review this card for the functions to be performed.
Exits should be operated only on the command of a crewmember.
IF YOU ARE SITTING IN AN EXIT ROW, PLEASE ASK TO BE RESEATED IF:
•You have a physical condition which may not be visible and which may prevent you from
assisting our crew.
•You lack the strength, mobility, dexterity in both arms, hands and legs to reach upward,
sideways and downwards to the locations of the exit and/or slide or cannot grasp, push,
pull, turn or otherwise manipulate the operating mechanism.
•You are unable to reach the exit, to maintain balance andor push, shove, pull or otherwise
open the exit and to get out quickly.
• You are unable to remove, lift out, deposit on a nearby seat, or maneuver over seatbacks
to the next row objects or obstructions the size and weight of overwing window exits.
•You are unable to stabilize an escape slide after deployment and/or unable to assist
others in getting off an escape slide
•You believe the physical exertion required to open the exit would injure you.
• You are hearing impaired and could not hear verbal commands from our crew
•You are unable to give oral commands in English to other passengers.
• You do not understand the instructions in this brochure.
•You have other responsibilities (such as a small child to care for) which would prevent
you from assisting our crew.
•You are less than 15 years old or lack the capacity to assist without help of another person.
•You do not wish to assist our crew in this way.
If you are sitting in an exit row and you cannot
read the small type on this card, or you cannot
see well enough to comply with these
instructions, please tell a crewmember.
Sun Country makes the final decision and determination if the exit row occupant is able
to perform the applicable functions.
Federal law requires all passengers, regardless of their seat location or physical condition,
must review this important information.
Follow these instructions, the directions of the crew, and posted signs.
Please do not remove this card from the aircraft.
